00044 #include "sunpos.h"
00045 #include <math.h>
00046 
00047 void sunpos(cTime udtTime,cLocation udtLocation, cSunCoordinates *udtSunCoordinates)
00048 {
00049         // Main variables
00050         double dJulianDate;
00051         double dElapsedJulianDays;
00052         double dDecimalHours;
00053         double dEclipticLongitude;
00054         double dEclipticObliquity;
00055         double dRightAscension;
00056         double dDeclination;
00057 
00058         // Auxiliary variables
00059         double dY;
00060         double dX;
00061 
00062         // Calculate difference in days between the current Julian Day 
00063         // and JD 2451545.0, which is noon 1 January 2000 Universal Time
00064         {
00065                 
00066                 long int liAux1;
00067                 long int liAux2;
00068                 // Calculate time of the day in UT decimal hours
00069                 dDecimalHours = udtTime.dHours + (udtTime.dMinutes 
00070                         + udtTime.dSeconds / 60.0 ) / 60.0;
00071                 // Calculate current Julian Day
00072                 liAux1 =(udtTime.iMonth-14)/12;
00073                 liAux2=(1461*(udtTime.iYear + 4800 + liAux1))/4 + (367*(udtTime.iMonth 
00074                         - 2-12*liAux1))/12- (3*((udtTime.iYear + 4900 
00075                 + liAux1)/100))/4+udtTime.iDay-32075;
00076                 dJulianDate=(double)(liAux2)-0.5+dDecimalHours/24.0;
00077                 // Calculate difference between current Julian Day and JD 2451545.0 
00078                 dElapsedJulianDays = dJulianDate-2451545.0;
00079         }
00080 
00081         // Calculate ecliptic coordinates (ecliptic longitude and obliquity of the 
00082         // ecliptic in radians but without limiting the angle to be less than 2*Pi 
00083         // (i.e., the result may be greater than 2*Pi)
00084         {
00085 
00086                 double dOmega;
00087                 dOmega=0.0172021241615*dElapsedJulianDays;
00088                 dEclipticLongitude=4.894969024 + 0.017202791697* dElapsedJulianDays 
00089                         + 5.78262765229295e-9 * dElapsedJulianDays * cos( 2.67824 + dOmega) 
00090                         + 0.03341656 * cos(4.6693 + dOmega) 
00091                         + 0.00034894 * cos(4.6261 + 0.03440424832 * dElapsedJulianDays) 
00092                         - 0.00008339 * sin(2.1824 - 0.00092421755 * dElapsedJulianDays)
00093                         + 0.00003934 * cos(2.7441 + 0.01575190938 * dElapsedJulianDays)
00094                         + 0.00003461 * cos(2.8289 + 9.64572211e-6 * dElapsedJulianDays)
00095                         + 0.00003136 * cos(3.6277 + 0.21276871047 * dElapsedJulianDays)
00096                         + 0.00002676 * cos(4.4181 + 0.02152065544 * dElapsedJulianDays) 
00097                         + 0.00003046 * cos(6.1352 + 0.01076032772 * dElapsedJulianDays);
00098                         
00099                 dEclipticObliquity =  0.4090928040395968 - 6.21395528282155e-9 * dElapsedJulianDays
00100                         + 0.00004459673713551599 * cos(2.182954286987892 - 9.24169576470094e-4 * dElapsedJulianDays)
00101                         - 2.782663310837079e-6 * cos(87.60120254057658 - 0.0344055570784386 * dElapsedJulianDays)
00102                         + 1.0435812166758367e-7 * cos(167.41964504653737 - 0.0698787501985692 * dElapsedJulianDays);
00103         }
00104 
00105         // Calculate celestial coordinates ( right ascension and declination ) in radians 
00106         // but without limiting the angle to be less than 2*Pi (i.e., the result may be 
00107         // greater than 2*Pi)
00108         {
00109                 double dSin_EclipticLongitude;
00110                 dSin_EclipticLongitude= sin( dEclipticLongitude );
00111                 dY = cos( dEclipticObliquity ) * dSin_EclipticLongitude; //sin correcci�n
00112                 dX = cos( dEclipticLongitude );
00113                 dRightAscension = atan2( dY,dX );
00114                 if( dRightAscension < 0.0 ) dRightAscension = dRightAscension + twopi;
00115                 dDeclination = asin( sin( dEclipticObliquity )*dSin_EclipticLongitude ); //sin correcci�n
00116         }
00117 
00118         // Calculate local coordinates ( azimuth and zenith angle ) in degrees
00119         {
00120                 double dGreenwichMeanSiderealTime;
00121                 double dLocalMeanSiderealTime;
00122                 double dLatitudeInRadians;
00123                 double dHourAngle;
00124                 double dCos_Latitude;
00125                 double dSin_Latitude;
00126                 double dCos_HourAngle;
00127                 double dParallax;
00128                 //dGreenwichMeanSiderealTime = 6.6974243242 + 
00129                 //      0.0657098283*dElapsedJulianDays 
00130                 //      + dDecimalHours;
00131                 dGreenwichMeanSiderealTime = -60053.302628 + 24.065709825 * dElapsedJulianDays 
00132                         - 0.000292222 * sin(0.0009242 * dElapsedJulianDays + 0.9574);
00133                 dLocalMeanSiderealTime = (dGreenwichMeanSiderealTime*15
00134                         + udtLocation.dLongitude)*rad;
00135                 dHourAngle = dLocalMeanSiderealTime - dRightAscension;
00136                 dLatitudeInRadians = udtLocation.dLatitude*rad;
00137                 dCos_Latitude = cos( dLatitudeInRadians );
00138                 dSin_Latitude = sin( dLatitudeInRadians );
00139                 dCos_HourAngle= cos( dHourAngle );
00140                 udtSunCoordinates->dZenithAngle = (acos( dCos_Latitude*dCos_HourAngle
00141                         *cos(dDeclination) + sin( dDeclination )*dSin_Latitude));
00142                 dY = -sin( dHourAngle );
00143                 dX = tan( dDeclination )*dCos_Latitude - dSin_Latitude*dCos_HourAngle;
00144                 udtSunCoordinates->dAzimuth = atan2( dY, dX );
00145                 if ( udtSunCoordinates->dAzimuth < 0.0 ) 
00146                         udtSunCoordinates->dAzimuth = udtSunCoordinates->dAzimuth + twopi;
00147                 udtSunCoordinates->dAzimuth = udtSunCoordinates->dAzimuth/rad;
00148                 // Parallax Correction
00149                 dParallax=(dEarthMeanRadius/dAstronomicalUnit)
00150                         *sin(udtSunCoordinates->dZenithAngle);
00151                 udtSunCoordinates->dZenithAngle=(udtSunCoordinates->dZenithAngle 
00152                         + dParallax)/rad;
00153                 udtSunCoordinates->dJuliano=dJulianDate;
00154         }
00155 }
